Sequence Information.Peptide Name: gcLEAP-2 (grass carp liver-expressed antimicrobial peptide-2; natural AMPs; fish, animals; 2S=S, UCSS1a)

Literature Information.Literature: Host expression: Upon induction by Aeromonas hydrophila, its expression was significantly up-regulated in liver, gill, skin, muscle, spleen, blood, head kidney, heart and intestine, but down-regulated in trunk kidney and brain.Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (87.8%) tofish GzLEAP-2AThere are two potential disulfide bonds. Mol. Wt: 4657.364; GRAVY: -0.67; Mol Formula:  C199H307N58O58S6; mol ex coeff: 10270.Activity: Purified gcLEAP-2 showed activity against Gram-negative aquatic pathogen A. hydrophila.  Updated 11/2010; 7/2021; 10/2023.
Literature Information.Author: Liu F, Li JL, Yue GH, Fu JJ, Zhou ZF.2011
Literature Information.Title: Molecular cloning and expression analysis of the liver-expressed antimicrobial peptide 2 (LEAP-2) gene in grass carp
